column1: Sunscreen is a cream or lotion used to protect the skin from the sun's rays.
Older sunscreens used para-aminobenzoic acid (PABA) to protect skin from the sun's rays.
Sunscreens may contain any of the following ingredients: - Cinnamates - Padimate-O - Salicylates (aspirin-like compounds) - Zinc oxide Note: This list may not include all ingredients.
Swallowing sunscreen usually just causes mild stomach upset and vomiting.
